column4: I'd really like to use Ubuntu, but it seems that my Toshiba laptop refuses to cooperate
I've tried installing from my USB drive, and after what appears to be a successful installation
I then tried to install within Windows to dual boot, just to see if that works
Explain what happens when you try to boot ubuntu
it looks like it's loading, then the screen goes black
Does it freeze the machine at that point? Or can you still here it working?
it's definitely frozen, the only thing I can do is ctrl-alt-del twice to reboot
Which graphics card do you have and which version of ubuntu did you install?
How far does ubuntu load up?
some typical text scrolls on the screen, indicating boot up, then it just goes black
Can you try booting with radeon.modeset=1 to see if it makes a difference?
I honestly don't know how to make that adjustment
At the grub prompt, press e then append this option to the line with vmlinuz after the other args (for instance ro quiet splash radeon.modeset=1)
